message_1: Calculate the cohomology group $H^2(\mathbb{R}P^3;\mathbb{Z}_3)$, where $\mathbb{R}P^3$ denotes the real projective space of dimension 3 and $\mathbb{Z}_3$ is the cyclic group of order 3.
message_2:
To compute the cohomology group $H^2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}_3)$, we will use the Universal Coefficient Theorem. First, we need to compute the homology groups of $\mathbb{R}P^3$. We know that the homology groups of $\mathbb{R}P^n$ are given by:

$H_k(\mathbb{R}P^n; \mathbb{Z}) = \begin{cases}
\mathbb{Z} & \text{if } k = 0 \\
\mathbb{Z}_2 & \text{if } 1 \leq k \leq n-1 \text{ and } k \text{ is odd} \\
0 & \text{otherwise}
\end{cases}$

So, for $\mathbb{R}P^3$, we have:

$H_0(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}$
$H_1(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}_2$
$H_2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}) = 0$
$H_3(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}) = \mathbb{Z}_2$

Now, we apply the Universal Coefficient Theorem for cohomology, which states that there is a short exact sequence:

$0 \to \text{Ext}(H_{k-1}(X; \mathbb{Z}), G) \to H^k(X; G) \to \text{Hom}(H_k(X; \mathbb{Z}), G) \to 0$

Here, $G = \mathbb{Z}_3$, and we want to compute $H^2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}_3)$. We have:

$\text{Ext}(H_1(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}), \mathbb{Z}_3) = \text{Ext}(\mathbb{Z}_2, \mathbb{Z}_3)$
$\text{Hom}(H_2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}), \mathbb{Z}_3) = \text{Hom}(0, \mathbb{Z}_3)$

Since $\mathbb{Z}_3$ is an injective $\mathbb{Z}$-module, we have $\text{Ext}(\mathbb{Z}_2, \mathbb{Z}_3) = 0$. Also, $\text{Hom}(0, \mathbb{Z}_3) = 0$. Therefore, the short exact sequence becomes:

$0 \to 0 \to H^2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}_3) \to 0 \to 0$

This implies that $H^2(\mathbb{R}P^3; \mathbb{Z}_3) = 0$.
